channel.title: Flash in html
channel.description: okay soo i published my flash project and its title is "me" and i was wondering what to do to make it so it can be displayed on a website, i think it has something to do with src something but i dunno that much html. so if someone could help that would be great.

item.title: Flash in html
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

No, try replacing what you have with “http://f13.putfile.com/getfile/15424129524035611642564146296290295280281164240497133/me.swf”

Nope…my assumption when I first saw that (and I obviously guessed right) was that that numerical path is randomly generated for each person…so that’s not much good either.

In regards to the question now, i would ask you to repost your code, but I did a bit of research into it and found that myspace filters out certain html tags, namely embed and object tags…I didn’t see a quick way around it from what I saw, so I guess this is beyond the level of simply fixes.

Read full topic

item.title: Flash in html
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Well that’s why…it needs to be uploaded somewhere where it can be referenced directly. Just as if you would link to an image…you must be able to link directly to the flash file. Putfile required 3 steps before you can access that, and plain old html can’t deal with that

I’d recommend looking for a simple free host where you can just upload it. If you look in this forum, you should find some links to free hosting sites.

Read full topic

</object>

item.title: Flash in html
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Try this out and tell me if it works. It displays one of adobe’s example files:

<object type="application/x-shockwave-flash" data="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/flash/sample_files/swf/clock.swf" width="300" height="300">
    <param name="movie" value="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/flash/sample_files/swf/clock.swf" />
    <param name="quality" value="high" />
    <param name="loop" value="false" />
</object>

Read full topic

    <param name="movie" value="me.swf" />
    <param name="quality" value="high" />
    <param name="loop" value="false" />
</object>

and it just shows the text, i dunno why.

Read full topic

item.title: Flash in html
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

You need to embed it into the page using the object tag…there are other methods, but this one is also supported by the xhtml 1.1 doctype definitions:

<object type="application/x-shockwave-flash" data="filename.swf" width="" height="">
    <param name="movie" value="filename.swf" />
    <param name="quality" value="high" />
    <param name="loop" value="false" />
</object>

Remember to replace both filename.swf instances and to input the desired width and height.

Read full topic
